TopicTitle: How have you broken your game?

Articles.Content:
Like Danny2462, this happened to me. I swear it just teleported out there, no set up. Freaky.

http://www.flickr.com/photos/77453858@N03/9108422330/

http://www.flickr.com/photos/77453858@N03/9106195145/

http://www.flickr.com/photos/77453858@N03/9106195443/

http://www.flickr.com/photos/77453858@N03/9106194929/

http://www.flickr.com/photos/77453858@N03/9106195253/

Yeah, he is freaking out too.

Quoting a famous Danny2462 sentence "Impossible speed, Impossible distance, my work here is done."

EDIT_____________

Turns out the image thing isnt working for me. Links! Sorry!

Edited June 22, 2013 by Jebadiah
Looks like you broke the forum post too XD
I was trying to land a rover on duna , but i entered in it's SOI in the wrong direction.Yeah , you know where this is going.Got thrusted into the ground at 3000 m/s ,planet galaxy popped.
Well, I didn't manage that, but I've landed on the surface of Jool, so I guess that counts as "breaking the game".
I once had a MechJeb box going about that fast after the spacecraft it was attached to exploded.
I once had a boat builded, with Jebediah in it. I let him go in EVA, I felt down on a part that was under water, the game crashed because Jebediah can't drown.

I once tried a direct launch to intercept my space station. Everything was going great, then there was a pause and about two second later a huge explosion that crashed the game. When I reloaded my station was gone. My best thought is that I was going 1000m/s too slow for my station, it loaded on the grid at 2.5km then ran my astronaut over.

-Lego
Second part.

-snip-

I broke reason itself.

I'm new enough not to get that reference. If you're suggesting it doesn't fly, I can assure you it does

I'm new enough not to get that reference. If you're suggesting it doesn't fly, I can assure you it does

Here's what it looks like:

But in the VAB. I always get one whenever I cluster massive chunks of parts
Ah. Ok. I've never used debug. It flies like there's no trouble, though Nothing buggy at the moment. Just... very, very few frames per second.

In testing just how fast I could get a rover to go on Kerbin, I may have let Jeb drive it off the edge of a mountain. The broken part (apart from the rover itself which disintegrated quite spectacularly) occurred when Jeb was thrown clear of the crash at a ludicrous speed. He landed some thirteen km away and was going fast enough to generate vapour effects on the way (

).

Who knows how or why it happened. Maybe the Kraken admired his bravery, decided he was worth saving and, with the flick of an invisible tentacle, catapulted him to safety.

(I posted this one a few months ago so apologies if you've already seen it but the original thread got eaten in the great forum cleansing of 2013.)
